cxro.common.io.modbus

Class BitVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • cxro.common.io.modbus.BitVector

  • public final class BitVector
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implements a collection for bits, storing them packed into bytes. The access operations will index from the LSB (rightmost) bit.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BitVector(byte[] data)
      Construct a vector by wrapping a byte array.
      BitVector(byte[] data, int size)
      Construct a vector by wrapping a byte array.
      BitVector(int size)
      Constructs a vector capable of holding size bits.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int byteSize()
      Returns the number of bytes used to store the collection of bits as int.
      void clear(int index)
      Sets the value of bit at index position is set to zero.
      void forceSize(int aSize)
      Forces the number of bits in this BitVector.
      boolean get(int index)
      Returns true if bit at index position is one and false if it is zero.
      boolean getBit(int index)
      Returns the state of the bit at the given index of this BitVector.
      byte[] getBytes()
      Returns the byte[] which is used to store the bits of this BitVector.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void set(int index)
      Sets the value of bit at index position to one.
      void setBit(int index, boolean b)
      Sets the state of the bit at the given index of this BitVector.
      void setBytes(byte[] aData)
      Sets the byte[] which stores the bits of this BitVector.
      void setBytes(byte[] aData, int aSize)
      Sets the byte[] which stores the bits of this BitVector.
      int size()
      Returns the number of bits in this vector.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representing the contents of the bit collection in a way that can be printed to a screen or log.

        public BitVector(byte[] data)
        Construct a vector by wrapping a byte array. Assume all bits are part of BitVector.
        Parameters:
        data - a byte[] containing packed bits.

      • BitVector

                 int size)
        Construct a vector by wrapping a byte array.
        Parameters:
        data - a byte[] containing packed bits.
        size - number of bits in vector.

      • size

        public final int size()
        Returns the number of bits in this vector. This is also one greater than the number of the largest valid bit number.
        Returns:
        size

      • setBytes

        public final void setBytes(byte[] aData,
                           int aSize)
        Sets the byte[] which stores the bits of this BitVector.

        Parameters:
        aData - a byte[] array containing bitmap.
        aSize - number of bits mapped in aData array.

      • getBit

        public final boolean getBit(int index)
        Returns the state of the bit at the given index of this BitVector.

        Parameters:
        index - the index of the bit to be returned.
        Returns:
        true if the bit at the specified index is set, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds.

      • setBit

        public final void setBit(int index,
                         boolean b)
        Sets the state of the bit at the given index of this BitVector.

        Parameters:
        index - the index of the bit to be set.
        b - true if the bit should be set, false if it should be reset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds.

      • forceSize

        public final void forceSize(int aSize)
        Forces the number of bits in this BitVector.
        Parameters:
        aSize -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the size exceeds the byte[] store size multiplied by 8.

      • byteSize

        public final int byteSize()
        Returns the number of bytes used to store the collection of bits as int.

        Returns:
        the number of bytes used to map this BitVector.
